page.title: 14 Complaints About Whitemoor
page.content: The fields around the farm have had to be redrained as the dike was not working. This is due to subsidence. Some of the concrete on and around the farm is cracking. All new roads on the farm are not being concreted. Instead, half housebricks are being used as they don't crack, they just move. Even the road past Whitemoor Mine to Cliffe has recently been re-surfaced. Our back garden path is starting to crack. We were told by coal board surveyors to expect a one metre subsidence but a mine worker told us to expect more.It is expected to be worse in l987. Apart from the subsidence, we hardly notice the mine until it starts blasting. It is quite a landmark if we get lost on some back road.
